paper_metadata.title: Epigallocatechin-3-Gallate as a Potential Therapeutic Drug for TTR-Related Amyloidosis: “In Vivo” Evidence from FAP Mice Models
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR V30M variant in the context of familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) and its treatment with EGCG, but does not provide specific penetrance data or individual-level records.

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that EGCG treatment reduces TTR deposition and associated markers in FAP mice models.

variants.segregation_data: The TTR V30M variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by FAP.
variants.additional_notes: The paper primarily focuses on the effects of EGCG on TTR-related amyloidosis without detailed penetrance data.
key_quotes: methionine for valine substitution at position 30, TTR V30M, the most common molecular abnormality in TTR
The onset of clinical symptoms generally occurs before age 40 with fast progression to death within 10 to 20 years.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper does not provide detailed penetrance data or individual-level records for the TTR variant.
